src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Zz0M4GmstTE:1sZXWqa9HHA:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Zz0M4GmstTE:1sZXWqa9HHA:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Zz0M4GmstTE:1sZXWqa9HHA:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Zz0M4GmstTE:1sZXWqa9HHA:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Zz0M4GmstTE\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 20 Sep 2020 08:33:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f64da1857b7da001ee12774?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"ce425a2c90e2fc9f899f3de1378a2710","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn87@2020_2/2020/09/20/17-35-50-983_7021b029df9d7d68.webp","destWidth":1631,"destHeight":1223,"sourceBytes":38860,"destBytes":38860,"author":"insider@insider.com (Kate Duffy)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5ec3f2fd5af6cc51cd4abfd9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn96@2020_2/2020/09/20/17-35-37-097_b3396fa8a44bd460.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn62@2020_4/2020/09/20/17-35-46-023_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Zz0M4GmstTE:1sZXWqa9HHA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn64@2020_2/2020/09/20/17-35-43-006_21c81f49267a76bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Zz0M4GmstTE:1sZXWqa9HHA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/20/17-35-41-565_06661225c0e8b666.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Zz0M4GmstTE:1sZXWqa9HHA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn3@2020_5/2020/09/20/17-35-48-765_25fe9ef5180efd37.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Zz0M4GmstTE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn89@2020_2/2020/09/20/17-35-40-631_71e6a669b3e6459d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600623333164},{"createdTime":"2020-09-21 01:35:33","updatedTime":"2020-09-21 01:35:33","title":"Job diary: I'm a professional mermaid who makes upwards of $250 for an appearance. Here's how I turned my passion for cosplay into a business.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/job-diary-day-in-the-life-of-a-professional-mermaid-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6500e0323fc4001e0d7315?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nymphia on the rocks photo credit Brandi Rollins\" height=\"2091\" width=\"2788\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Gabrielle Rivera as Nymphia, the Nautilus Mermaid, near the Golden Gate Bridge,\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brandi Rollins</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Gabrielle Rivera is a 25-year-old professional mermaid based in the Bay Area, California.</li>\n<li>At the age of 19, a friend introduced Rivera to online community of merfolk, people also interested in mermaids and costuming. From there, her character Nymphia, The Nautilus Mermaid, was born.</li>\n<li>Today, Rivera performs as Nymphia everywhere from corporate events and kids' parties, to aquarium and water shows, starting at a rate of $250 for a 90-minute appearance.</li>\n<li>Rivera says that as a trans woman, cosplay and working as a mermaid has helped her explore and build up confidence in her femininity.</li>\n<li>Here's her story, as told to freelance author Jenny Powers.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>For as long as I can remember, I've been drawn to the sea. Some of my earliest childhood memories as a little boy are spending time on the San Diego beaches with my mom.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f65040e57b7da001ee12891?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gabrielle Rivera Nymphia baby photo with beach background\" height=\"2016\" width=\"1512\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rivera as a baby during a sea-inspired photo shoot.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Gabrielle Rivera</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In high school I began doing <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-cosplay-2014-10\">cosplay</a>, attending my first event, The San Diego Comic-Con in 2009. I enjoyed sewing and costuming recreationally, so it was a great match for my interests.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Early on, I made my own mermaid fabric costume compete with a swimmable version of Ariel's tail.</strong></h2><p>I even wound up taking a <a href=\"https://mermaidislandtours.com/index.html\">mermaid class</a> wearing the tail. The class taught us a series of basic swim styles such as the dolphin kick, flips and corkscrew turns.</p><p>I also enjoyed taking photographs so, at the age of 19, I combined these interests and took a job as a photo ambassador and wardrobe assistant at SeaWorld. It was 2014, the same year I'd begun doing pencil sketches of a character I'd dreamed up that I'd later call <a href=\"https://www.theseafaringmermaid.org/\">Nymphia, The Nautilus Mermaid</a>.</p><p>Soon after, a merman friend of mine introduced me to <a href=\"https://mernetwork.com/index/content.php?s=dfb8813ded209f28a315d21396301bf2\">MerNetwork</a>, a merfolk community, and encouraged me to get involved. It didn't take long for me to get hooked.</p><p>In 2016, I headed off to Otis College of Art &#38; Design in Los Angeles to study fashion design. I ended up leaving after the first semester, returning to SeaWorld as a seasonal employee.&#160;</p><p>That same year I got my first paid mermaid gig. A friend recommended me for a mermaid meet and greet at The Escondido Renaissance Faire, which was a lot of fun. I wore my Ariel tail, and together we greeted people in a grotto set-up and handed out treasure to the children. That was the day I brought my character Nymphia to life for the first time.&#160;</p><h2><strong>It was my mom who first pointed out that this could be a business for me.</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f65007f57b7da001ee12879?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gabrielle Rivera Nymphia full body tail photo credit Brandi Rollins\" height=\"2048\" width=\"1638\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Nymphia wearing her full body tail.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brandi Rollins</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>I live with my parents in Oakland and the three of us were regularly meeting in our living room, conducting informal business meetings, and discussing what it would take for me to turn this into a reality. We talked about everything from resources to costuming to budget. With their support, for the first time, I remember thinking becoming a professional entrepre-mermaid might just be an actual possibility.</p><p>From there, I joined a local group known as the Ocean Beach Mer Pod, and soon I was doing both paid and volunteer appearances. Two months after my first mermaid gig, I got certified as an Open Water Scuba Diver through PADI. I also commissioned husband and wife duo, Jim and Alicia Ward of <a href=\"http://www.seethroughsea.com/custom-mermaid-tails.html\"><em>See Through Sea</em></a>, to design a custom silicone mermaid tail which cost $2,700. It weighs 36 pounds, and feels like you're swimming with a dumbbell attached to you. It's made of medical-grade silicone and it feels more like a prosthetic than a costume. I named her Moana.&#160;</p><p>Silicone tails are a big investment, running between $1,000 to $6,000 depending on the maker. They are mostly handmade by small creators however there are a handful of larger companies like <a href=\"https://www.themertailor.com/\">Mertailor</a> which offer mass silicones.</p><p>Fabric tails like neoprene are more comfortable, weigh less, are easier to put on, and way more cost-effective ($300-$500) but they're nowhere near as realistic looking.&#160;</p><p>When it comes to silicone versus fabric, it really comes down to just picking your poison.</p><h2><strong>It typically takes me between two and a half to three hours to get into full costume.&#160;</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f65047757b7da001ee12896?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nymphia on a log, photo credit Brandi Rollins\" height=\"2048\" width=\"1639\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It can take up to three hours to get fully dressed as Nymphia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brandi Rollins</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>Getting my tail on is a process. I begin by applying a water-based lubricant to my legs so I can slide into it easier. Then I lay down on a yoga mat and put my feet into the monofin, and begin sliding it up the length of my body. It usually takes me half an hour to do and it feels like I'm wearing a giant condom on my body because silicone suctions to your skin.&#160;</p><p>I'm a makeup geek so that part takes the longest, especially when it comes to the feminine contouring. I wear a lace front wig that I glue to my scalp and use a small army of bobby pins and a crown to anchor it down. One time it came off in the water and all my makeup smeared, but luckily it was during a practice swim.</p><h2><strong>Cosplay really helped me build up confidence in my femininity, and I feel my most feminine as a mermaid.</strong></h2><p>I didn't come out to my parents as trans until I was living in Los Angeles in 2017. It was more of a passive kind of talk, but by then I was already using feminine pronouns to refer to myself.&#160;</p><h2><strong>At times, it can be harder to book events as a transgender woman.&#160;</strong></h2><p>People won't admit that's why they don't hire me, but I've heard it through the grapevine. I'm very upfront about being trans. In fact, I recently served as an ambassador and speaker for trans merfolk at the California Mermaid Convention in 2019.</p><p>When I do work, I do it all — kids' parties, corporate events, beach visits and meet and greets, and aquarium and water shows. My rate is $250 for a 90-minute appearance on dry land and $275 in the water.&#160;</p><h2><strong>I always have an assistant on hand whose job is to act like my land legs.&#160;</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6503d4323fc4001e0d732c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gabrielle Rivera Nymphia and Pirate assistant photo credit Brandi Rollins\" height=\"2400\" width=\"3199\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rivera often has her assistant dress up in a pirate costume.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brandi Rollins</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>If I'm working near the water, I can just roll into it, but if I'm on dry land, my assistant carries me — which isn't the easiest task, considering I weigh 162 pounds and my tail weighs nearly another 40. Sometimes he tosses me over his shoulder and carries me into an event like the catch of the day. It's also helpful to have him with me in case some drunk guy tries to play let's drown the mermaid. Fortunately, I haven't had any run-ins with that personally, but in my industry, we've all heard the stories.&#160;</p><p>In addition to my mermaid work, I work as the lifeguard instructor for Bay Club at The Gateway, a private fitness club in San Francisco.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Both my jobs require me to be at my mental and physical best.</strong></h2><p>This means plenty of sleep (8-10 hours nightly), lots of protein (eggs are my best friend), practice swims, vocal warm-ups, and deep breathing exercises. I can hold my breath underwater in a static position for two minutes and 25 seconds, and my active breath-hold is between 45-75 seconds if I swim really slowly on a good day. Once during a photo shoot, the legendary mermaid model and activist ocean ecology activist, Hannah Fraser, joked I almost killed her underwater photographer because I held my breath for so long.</p><p>Since COVID-19, business is a lot slower because no one is hosting events, but I've found ways to branch out. I've begun offering virtual storytime, as well as personalized videos for special occasions or simply to say 'shello' for between $35-50. The pandemic has also provided me with the downtime I needed to create a free <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzHSjnPCWWIazB4E01adWLg?view_as=subscriber\">YouTube channel</a> for kids storytimes, as well as a <a href=\"https://anchor.fm/legendofthesea\">podcast</a> called Nymphia: Legend of the Sea.&#160;</p><h2><strong>For me, this is not just a job, it's a lifestyle.&#160;</strong></h2><p>Whatever methods I can use to encourage people to dream big through my work, I use.&#160;</p><p>It's especially important for me, as a 25-year-old woman of trans identity, to spread the message that anyone can achieve their wildest dreams.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 01:35:33","updatedTime":"2020-09-21 01:35:33","title":"This new $90,390 luxury motorhome can accommodate up to 5 people using shifting and hidden amenities — see inside the iSmove","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/ismove-90390-luxury-motorhome-accommodate-up-to-5-people-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6222fb323fc4001e0d6907?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF Slider\" height=\"1405\" width=\"1874\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Niesmann+Bischoff has debuted its newest motorhome, the <a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\">iSmove</a>.</li>\n<li>The Fiat Ducato-based motorhome can accommodate up to five people by using flexible furniture and living spaces.</li>\n<li>The interior includes a separate bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, leisure and dining area, and a bed that can be stored in the ceiling.</li>\n<li>The iSmove can stay off-grid for up to nine days with a fully upgraded power system.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Niesmann+Bischoff has debuted its newest motorhome, the <a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\">iSmove</a>, which sits on the body of a Fiat Ducato and relies on movable furniture to accomodate up to five people.</p><p>The Germany-based motorhome maker, which is a subsidiary of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mercedes-benz-sprinter-turned-into-luxury-tiny-home-2019-9\">Erwin Hymer Group</a>, currently has three other tiny homes on wheels in its lineup: the Smove, Arto, and Flair. But unlike these previous models, the iSmove was created to \"<a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/#\">break all the rules</a>\" by integrating new design elements into the shape shifting space.</p><p>Like other motorhome makers around the world, Niesmann+Bischoff was negatively impacted by the coronavirus pandemic after the company had to shut its factory operations down and delay delivery dates, <a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/news/coronavirus/\">according to a news release posted in March</a>.</p><p>But now, the motorhome maker is bouncing back into the market with its latest unveiling, which comes at a fortuitous time in which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rv-sales-skyrocketing-as-lockdown-ends-2020-6\">RV makers have seen a spike in inquiries and sales</a> as more people have started considering road instead of air travel.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tNiesmann+Bischoff's newest unveiling has redesigned the classic motorhome look by using flexible amenities and seven patent-pending features — like a flushed ceiling bed and sliding shower — all throughout the interior.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627b80323fc4001e0d6b6e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF Slider\" height=\"1405\" width=\"1874\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe motorhome's aluminum walls with styrofoam insulation can be optionally lined with felt for better \"ambient sounds\" inside the motorhome.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627bb1323fc4001e0d6b71?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove acoustic walls detail\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUnlike many traditional tiny homes on wheels, the entry door into the iSmove is windowless, which makes the interior look more put together, according to Niesmann+Bischoff.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627bbc57b7da001ee12152?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove kitchen\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s kitchen.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a standing room for most people.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627bcd323fc4001e0d6b72?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Scalaria_148\" height=\"1050\" width=\"2101\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUnlike most motorhomes and camper vans that are millennial-friendly by being all-white, the iSmove has dark ceilings, which gives the interior a cozy feel, according to its maker.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6279f4323fc4001e0d6b61?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove anthracite including a bedroom, a bathroom across from the kitchen, a living room area …\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627bff57b7da001ee12154?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove clear lines of sight for an amazing sence of space\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The interior of the iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a bed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627c06323fc4001e0d6b74?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove lifting bed open\" height=\"1575\" width=\"2106\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s hidden bed.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe secondary lifting bed can be stored in the ceiling above the cockpit when it's not in use.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s living room.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" space: clients can either opt to have one queen bed, or two smaller beds.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627c1157b7da001ee12155?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove 7.3F target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe number of beds also affects the dimensions of the vehicle: the single bed model is longer than the 22.95-foot long double bed model by a little less than one foot.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627c2b323fc4001e0d6b75?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove 6.9E bedroom single beds\" model.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627c9e57b7da001ee12157?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Scalaria_163\" height=\"1549\" width=\"2065\" additional costs, ranging from different accent colors to multimedia systems to kitchen add-ons.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627ca9323fc4001e0d6b7a?format=jpeg\" hidden storage spot.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627cbf323fc4001e0d6b7b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove wardrobe storage below the bed\" height=\"1873\" width=\"2498\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s under-bed wardrobe.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe sleeping space can also be blocked off from the rest of the motorhome by using an optional kitchen shelf (we'll get to that in a bit) and a sliding door.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627ccc57b7da001ee12159?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove rotating back seat face to face\" height=\"1852\" width=\"2469\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s seats.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe L-shaped kitchen — which sits between the living area and the bedroom — can be upgraded with the Premium Kitchen package. This allows the unit to extend and expand when in use.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627ce7323fc4001e0d6b7c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove expandable kitchen\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s kitchen.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWith this upgrade, food can be prepared on the pull-out cutting board and expandable countertop, and then cooked on the dual gas stovetop.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627cf957b7da001ee1215c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove kitchen electric kitchen shelf\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s kitchen.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere’s also a refrigerator drawer for prolonged food storage.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627d1157b7da001ee1215d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove compressor refrigerator\" height=\"1874\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s refrigereator.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUnlike most kitchens, the iSmove has an electric shelf that can be lowered in order to hide itself when the kitchen space is not in use.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627d2457b7da001ee1215e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove kitchen electric kitchen shelf 2\" height=\"1878\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s kitchen.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis shelf also serves as the additional divider between the main bedroom and the rest of the motorhome.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627d3d323fc4001e0d6b82?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Exceptional feel good atmosphere thanks to an innovative lighting concept\" height=\"975\" width=\"1952\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s interior\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAcross the way is the bathroom, which has a full hidden shower that can slide into place and away from the toilet and sink when it's needed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627d7657b7da001ee12162?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove showerable door\" height=\"1876\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s shower.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere are also motion sensor lights in the bathroom, which means occupants won't have to stumble around at night just to use the toilet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627d8a323fc4001e0d6b85?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove spacious bathroom\" height=\"1878\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s bathroom.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tTowards the front half of the motorhome is the leisure area, which includes seating options and table for dining, lounging, or work if you’re a digital nomad.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627d9a323fc4001e0d6b88?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove back seats rotated in driving position\" height=\"1852\" width=\"2469\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s back seats in the driving position.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe passenger bench seat — which comes with seatbelts — can optionally rotate to face the table.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627db057b7da001ee12168?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove lifting bed You only see it when you need it\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s hidden bed.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor those who want additional seating, Niesmann+Bischoff can also include a fifth seat  across the table with built-in storage.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627dba323fc4001e0d6b8c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Scalaria_134\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe driver and main passenger seats can swivel to face the interior and table as well, creating a leisure space that can accommodate a whole family.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627988323fc4001e0d6b5f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove interior living room upholstery GrandCru 7\" height=\"1179\" width=\"1572\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s living room.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOccupants seated at the table also have the optional 32-inch television and sound system in their line of sight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627dc657b7da001ee1216a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Scalaria_127\" height=\"1452\" width=\"1936\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhen the driver and passenger seats aren't rotated to face the interior, the seats will face the cockpit, which has side drawers and phone or tablet charging and holding stations.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627dd057b7da001ee1216b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove multifunctional cockpit\" height=\"1674\" width=\"2232\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s cockpit.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere are also 230-volt and USB sockets around the interior.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627ddc323fc4001e0d6b90?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove bathroom sink toilette\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s bathroom.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe tiny home on wheels can be brightened with its ambient indirect, reading, and in-ceiling lights.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6279e8323fc4001e0d6b60?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove anthracite ceiling for an extraordinary feel good atmosphere\" height=\"1477\" width=\"1970\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The lights inside of the iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe brightness of several of these lights can then be adjusted on the glass panel touchscreen, which also serves as the control panel for other amenities.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627df3323fc4001e0d6b91?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Scalaria_189\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor gear storage, iSmove has optional exterior drawers and a rear garage that can hold items like bicycles or surfboards.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627e02323fc4001e0d6b92?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove rear garage bikes\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s rear garage storage for bicycles.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe iSmove can stay off-grid by using the 52.83-gallon fresh and 31.7-gallon waste water tanks, and the 100-amp hour lithium battery system.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627e0c57b7da001ee12170?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Bathroom shower\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s bathroom.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tTo further these off-grid capabilities, the iSmove can also be upgraded to have up to three 100-amp hour battery systems, a 125-watt solar panels, a 13.21-gallon gas tank, and a 31.7-gallon toilet in the bathroom.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627e18323fc4001e0d6b95?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Scalaria_064\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIf the power system is upgraded to the maximum that Niesmann+Bischoff allows, the vehicle will be able to stay off-grid for nine days, according to its maker.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627e2157b7da001ee12171?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove lithium technology in rear garage 01\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s lithium batteries.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/campervan-lithium-battery/\">Niesmann+Bischoff&#160;</a></em></p>\n\tFor those who want a cold-proof vehicle, the iSmove can also be upgraded with a winter pack, which comes with a water, floor, windscreen, and driver's cab heater …\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6220ee57b7da001ee11edb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove storage list\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome&#39;s storage capabilities.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t… thicker windows, and an air conditioning unit with heating capabilities.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627e4857b7da001ee12173?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove Scalaria_003\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iSmove motorhome.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.niesmann-bischoff.com/en/ismove/\" target=\"_blank\">Niesmann&#43;Bischoff</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tInterior colors and materials on amenities such as the wall storage units, drawers, and seat cushions can be picked from Niesmann+Bischoff's catalogue.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f627e3d323fc4001e0d6b96?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NIESMANN&#43;BISCHOFF iSmove detail drawer drivers cabin\" 01:35:33","updatedTime":"2020-09-21 01:35:33","title":"This $500 million concept megayacht was inspired by Japanese anime and designed to look like a swan — take a look at the Avanguardia","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/avanguardia-concept-megayacht-inspired-japanese-anime-designed-swan-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f60c57957b7da001ee119ba?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1405\" width=\"1874\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rome-based Lazzarini Design Studio unveiled the Avanguardia, a concept megayacht shaped like a swan.</li>\n<li>The design was inspired by 1970s and 1980s Japanese anime shows, according to its maker.</li>\n<li>The \"neck\" is movable, and the \"head\" &#8212; which otherwise serves as the command center &#8212; can be detached and turned into a tender.</li>\n<li>If a client wants to build the yacht, Lazzarini Design Studio estimates the total cost would be about $500 million.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Lazzarini Design Studio unveiled the <a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\">Avanguardia</a>, a concept megayacht shaped like a swan with a movable neck and removable head.</p><p>Avanguardia, which is Italian for vanguard or avant-garde, is a seemingly fitting name for this uniquely shaped yacht that prominently features a swan head-like control tower above the rest of the ship.</p><p>According to the Rome-based design studio, the yacht was inspired by several 1970s and 1980s Japanese anime series that depicted the head of robots as command centers. But in terms of the specific swan component, its designer drew inspiration from a single anime: \"Casshan\", a series that featured a robot swan character pretending to be a woman.&#160;</p><p>Keep scrolling to see the yacht:</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe neck of the swan head-control tower would be extendable and movable.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b46323fc4001e0d6739?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1404\" width=\"1873\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhen the yacht is in motion, the neck and head could be lowered towards the middle of the ship and be used as the cockpit.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b4c57b7da001ee11d7a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis maneuverability also would allow the neck to drop towards the water so the head of the swan could be detached and used as a separate 52.49-foot tender.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b53323fc4001e0d673a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Avanguardia adds about 65.62 feet to its length when the neck is lowered towards the water, increasing the total length of the ship to about 515.09 feet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b5c57b7da001ee11d7c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhen the head is detached, the \"top part\" of the yacht would become the backup control tower.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b62323fc4001e0d673b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1404\" width=\"1873\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe removable head isn't the only water toy on the megayacht: the rear of the deck could hold two electric Jet Capsules that are also designed by the company.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b6a57b7da001ee11d7d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1404\" width=\"1873\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThese Jet Capsules could be detached and used as separate watercraft...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b83323fc4001e0d673c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1405\" width=\"1874\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t... or attached to the structure of the yacht to serve as additional propulsion devices.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612b9957b7da001ee11d7e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBesides the Jet Capsule propulsion, the concept ship is powered by dual electric side engines and a MTU Rolls-Royce Jet engine.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612bb1323fc4001e0d673f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"902\" width=\"1804\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn total, these systems give the yacht a cruising speed of 18 knots.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612bb9323fc4001e0d6740?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1404\" width=\"1873\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe concept megayacht would have five separate decks that can accommodate up to 60 passengers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612bd957b7da001ee11d85?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFive other tenders — excluding the head — and two helicopters would be able to fit on the yacht ...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612bfd323fc4001e0d6746?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t... which would have two hangars built-in.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612c0557b7da001ee11d87?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1404\" width=\"1873\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn total, Avanguardia's beam sits at around 72.18 feet with a draft of about 21.33 feet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612bf357b7da001ee11d86?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIf a client wanted to build the Avanguardia, Lazzarini Design Studio estimates that the total cost will come out to around $500 million.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612c10323fc4001e0d6747?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Avanguardia megayacht\" height=\"1172\" width=\"2345\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Avanguardia concept megayacht.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.lazzarinidesignstudio.com/avanguardia\" target=\"_blank\">Lazzarini Design Studio</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article 35-43-451_9dc9286233289ba3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f612c0557b7da001ee11d87?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn82@2020_1/2020/09/20/17-35-44-708_e3ad0140295304a0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f612bf357b7da001ee11d86?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn21@2020_1/2020/09/20/17-35-46-568_3e53adebcefa0d2f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f612c10323fc4001e0d6747?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn11@2020_4/2020/09/20/17-35-40-050_cf6c99e391a32600.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn62@2020_4/2020/09/20/17-35-46-023_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=G-2CqHUFFY4:osWbxM4CbSU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn56@2020_1/2020/09/20/17-35-39-707_cbd1b949ea0dfa2e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=G-2CqHUFFY4:osWbxM4CbSU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn7@2020_4/2020/09/20/17-35-44-750_f6c0c382bf168a1e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=G-2CqHUFFY4:osWbxM4CbSU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn70@2020_4/2020/09/20/17-35-44-649_7a29851f6e104e05.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/G-2CqHUFFY4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn16@2020_3/2020/09/20/17-35-47-227_a2168f4079826181.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600623333165},{"createdTime":"2020-09-21 01:35:33","updatedTime":"2020-09-21 01:35:33","title":"The Tesla Model 3 might have the new Polestar 2 EV beat on paper, but the Polestar won me over — here's why","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-model-vs-3-polestar-2-ev-electric-vehicle-comparison-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64e61157b7da001ee127ce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3 versus Polestar 2.\" height=\"943\" width=\"1678\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3 versus Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla and Kristen Lee/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>I've tested both the <a href=\"https://jalopnik.com/the-2018-tesla-model-3-long-range-is-the-perfect-mix-of-1828853186\">Tesla Model 3</a> and the new <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/polestar-2-review-price-ev-volvo-tesla-specs-horsepower-electric-2020-8\">Polestar 2</a>. Both are five-seater luxury EVs.</li>\n<li>They largely drive the same; the big differences are in the packaging and user experiences.</li>\n<li>Though the Tesla performs better on paper, I liked the Polestar because it has a more usable interior.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In terms of more compact, luxury EVs with decent range, the Tesla Model 3 and Polestar 2 are pretty evenly matched. Both offer five seats, all-electric driving, and quick acceleration. Here's how they stack up against each other.</p><p>As a quick refresher, the Polestar 2 is the first all-electric car from the new Volvo- and Geely-backed brand. It was officially unveiled in 2019 with US deliveries to reservation holders scheduled to start this month.</p><p>The Model 3 is Tesla's first stab at a lower-cost EV for the masses. There were <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2018-07-12/how-tesla-s-model-3-became-elon-musk-s-version-of-hell?sref=P6Q0mxvj\">some production issues in the beginning</a>, but soon after the car became <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/business/autos/la-fi-hy-tesla-deliveries-sales-april-20190501-story.html\">the most popular EV in the US</a>.</p><p>I've spent time in both the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/polestar-2-review-price-ev-volvo-tesla-specs-horsepower-electric-2020-8\">Polestar 2</a> and the <a href=\"https://jalopnik.com/the-2018-tesla-model-3-long-range-is-the-perfect-mix-of-1828853186\">Model 3 Long Range</a>. Both have their strengths — but most importantly, both are solid EV choices for anyone looking to transition away from internal combustion engines. They don't rely on fossil fuels, but everything else about them basically feels like you're driving a normal car.</p><h2><strong>Interior</strong></h2><h3><strong>Tesla Model 3</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64bfb257b7da001ee126c1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_2\" height=\"1560\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The Tesla Model 3's interior is famously minimalist, with everything controlled via the big, horizontally mounted center touch screen. From there, you can view the car's status, navigation instructions, and music options.&#160;<p>I found the screen to be an interesting idea, but impractical in practice. I dislike having to look away from the road to adjust something via a touchscreen. There wasn't a traditional driver-facing information cluster, either.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64bfd657b7da001ee126c2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_3\" height=\"1664\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Also, the center console surface is covered with piano black trim — reflective, black plastic — which I hate because it gets grubby with fingerprints so quickly. Underneath all the piano-black trim, however, is a huge amount of very handy storage space.</p><p>The rest of the Model 3's interior is just as stark, but the leathers are soft and the wood inlaid in the dash is a nice touch. It seats five passengers and has a decent-sized trunk, as well as a front trunk. Tesla <a href=\"https://www.tesla.com/presskit\">quotes</a> the luggage capacity to be 15 cubic feet.</p><h3><strong>Polestar 2</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36b389e89ebf001f0449ae?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_OEM_10\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Polestar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The 2's interior looks like a car interior, which I am more familiar with and prefer using. There's also a big touchscreen, yes, but there's also an information cluster you can easily see while driving.&#160;<p>The 2 also has Google's Android operating system built in, which meant that the interface and user experience were all familiar to me, an Android user. It's an intuitive system and didn't force me to learn a new UI/UX just because I was in an unfamiliar car.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36b387e89ebf001f0449a9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_OEM_4\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Polestar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Interior materials were also nice to the touch, but Polestar's commitment to sustainability — seat fabrics made from recycled plastic bottles, interior plastics made from waste cork products, and floor mats made from recycled fishing nets — is cool. A leather interior is available upon request, though.</p><p>The 2 also has a front trunk in addition to its rear trunk. Polestar quotes the luggage capacity to be 15.5 cubic feet.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Exterior</strong></h2><h3><strong>Tesla Model 3</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c102323fc4001e0d711b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_9\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>According to <a href=\"https://www.tesla.com/presskit\">Tesla's own measurements</a>, the Model 3 is 184.8 inches long, 82.2 inches wide with mirrors, and 56.8 inches tall.&#160;</p><p>Its design is far softer and more oblong than the 2's, with rounded headlights.</p><h3><strong>Polestar 2</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36b384e89ebf001f0449a7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_OEM_1\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Polestar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The 2, according to Polestar's measurements, is 181.3 inches long, 78.1 inches wide with mirrors, and 58.2 inches tall.<p>Maybe it's because there are so many Model 3s driving around now that everyone knows what they look like, but the 2 is visually far more striking to me. I love the Thor's Hammer daytime running lights and the overall shape of the vehicle.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Driving Impressions</strong></h2><h3><strong>Tesla Model 3</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c03e57b7da001ee126c6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_7\" height=\"1406\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>Evaluating electric cars on how they drive is sort of a pointless exercise, as they all drive basically the same: seamless acceleration, silent save for the futuristic whirring, quick. The big differences come down to the packaging, fit and finish, and the user experience.&#160;<p>In Long Range, Dual Motor, all-wheel drive setup, the Model 3 produces <a href=\"https://www.motortrend.com/cars/tesla/model-3/2018/2018-tesla-model-3-long-range-dual-motor-first-test-review/#:~:text=Nothing%20demonstrates%20that%20new%20reality,context%20really%20drives%20it%20home.\">a claimed 346 horsepower</a> and can achieve an estimated 145 mph top speed and hit 60 mph in <a href=\"https://www.tesla.com/model3/design#battery\">just 4.4 seconds</a>.&#160;</p><p>If you opt for the Model 3 Performance, however, the claimed power output jumps to <a href=\"https://www.thecarconnection.com/overview/tesla_model-3_2020\">450 horsepower and 471 pound-feet of torque</a>. Zero to 60 mph is achieved in <a href=\"https://www.tesla.com/model3/design#battery\">an estimated</a> 3.2 seconds and there's a 162 mph top speed.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c10f323fc4001e0d711c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3\" height=\"2000\" width=\"1712\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The Long Range Model 3 is quick, but the Performance Model 3 feels like a rocket. The acceleration is so instant that it feels like being shot forward with the world's biggest cannon. It never got old. It was never not entertaining.</p><p>In my own evaluation, I found the Model 3's steering to be weighted very favorably, not too light and not too heavy. It felt quite natural.</p><p>Forward visibility out of the Model 3 was also phenomenal. The low, short hood gave a near-unencumbered view through the windshield.&#160;</p><p>The Model 3 also offers Autopilot capabilities — Tesla's advanced driver-assistance system, which does not allow for fully automated driving. In my own experience, Autopilot and General Motors' Super Cruise are among the best driver-assistance systems currently on the market.</p><h3><strong>Polestar 2</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36b2f2e89ebf001f04499c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_KL_18\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kristen Lee/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The 2 produces a claimed 408 horsepower and 487 pound-feet of torque. It also has an all-wheel-drive setup. Zero to 60 mph takes an estimated 4.5 seconds. Polestar did not provide a top speed estimate.&#160;<p>I didn't love the 2's steering feedback. In its standard setting, it was far too light. In sport mode, there was a bit more weight to it, but I never felt like it adequately communicated the road very well to me.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36b2f2e89ebf001f04499b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_KL_14\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kristen Lee/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>Everything else was great, though. The car's low center of gravity and instant acceleration made it feel much smaller and dartier than it actually was. One-pedal driving is also very easy to master.<p>The 2 is also very quick, and for the purposes of the general public, doesn't need to be any quicker. But if you want the neck-snapping acceleration, nothing really beats the Model 3 Performance.&#160;</p><p>The 2 offers Pilot Assist, <a href=\"https://www.motortrend.com/news/volvo-pilot-assist-how-it-works/\">Volvo's version of driver-assistance technology</a>, but I didn't get a chance to try it.</p><h2><strong>Range</strong></h2><h3><strong>Tesla Model 3</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c73f57b7da001ee12702?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_5\" height=\"1406\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>In its Long Range configuration, the Model 3 returns an estimated 322 miles, which surpasses that mystical 300-mile mark that people seemed to be stuck on. The Standard Range Plus Model 3, which comes with rear-wheel drive, is an estimated 250 miles. The Performance has an estimated range of 299 miles.<p>Tesla also has an expansive Supercharger network, which means that there are more places for owners to charge their Teslas when away from home.</p><h3><strong>Polestar 2</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36b2f0e89ebf001f044997?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_KL_11\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kristen Lee/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The 2 has been available for a much shorter amount of time than the Model 3, so there's really only one version available to buyers during the time of this writing: the \"launch edition.\"<p>The 2 has not yet been tested by the EPA, but InsideEVs suggests that the range could be <a href=\"https://insideevs.com/news/419595/polestar-2-epa-range-target/\">275 miles</a>.</p><p>Polestar cars use the Combined Charging System plug, which is different from the one Teslas use. A Polestar spokesperson admitted to me that Tesla has the jump in terms of public charging infrastructure, but he's confident that the rest of the charging network will catch up quickly enough.</p><h2><strong>Price</strong></h2><h3><strong>Tesla Model 3</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c098323fc4001e0d7119?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_8\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The Standard Range Plus starts at $37,990, the Long Range starts at $46,990, and the Performance starts at $54,990.&#160;<p>Tesla also famously operates with a direct-sales model, which has run into <a href=\"https://jalopnik.com/tesla-finally-cracks-a-ban-on-direct-to-consumer-sales-1841155463\">well-documented disagreements with local dealership franchise laws</a>. For you, the consumer, this can mean that there might not always be a Tesla store near your home, but it could also mean fewer variations in store-to-store buying experiences.</p><h3><strong>Polestar 2</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4e9aeae6ff30001d4e66d5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_OEM_5\" height=\"1664\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Polestar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>The launch edition 2 starts at $59,900. A base model <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/polestar-2-review-price-ev-volvo-tesla-specs-horsepower-electric-2020-8\">will be available later on</a>, but this is what we have for now.</p><p>As a fledgling brand, Polestar doesn't have as many stores as Tesla does. The company hopes to have more than 20 locations in its network within the next couple of years, but for now, the main markets are San Francisco, Los Angeles, and the tri-state area, according to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-buy-polestar-2-electric-car-ev-volvo-dealership-2020-9\">a company spokesperson</a>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36bb27e89ebf001f044a4b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2.\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Polestar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>However, Polestar will be able to rely on Volvo's established dealer network for service and will also offer a free pickup and delivery service anywhere within a 150-mile radius of a participating Polestar location.&#160;</p><p>Polestar will not operate with a direct-sales model, but because the company allows for extensive online ordering, the company spokesperson was confident that the buying experience will be simple and stress-free.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-buy-polestar-2-electric-car-ev-volvo-dealership-2020-9\">You can read about how Polestar sales and service will work here</a>.</p><h2><strong>Verdict</strong></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c7c657b7da001ee12707?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_1\" height=\"2014\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>Despite how much fun I had zooming around all over the place in the Performance Model 3, I think I'd still take the Polestar 2.&#160;<p>I think it looks better on the outside and I find the interior far more usable. It's futuristic and screen-heavy, sure, but it's also still a <em>car's</em> interior. I don't need to learn new multi-tasking skills just to use it. And having Android automotive as the native operating system is nice.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64b631323fc4001e0d70e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_OEM_21\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Polestar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>I also liked the feel of the interior materials. The \"vegan\" interior didn't appear any less premium even though it didn't use cowhide.&#160;</p><p>Overall, I thought the 2's fit and finish was nicer than the Tesla's, <a href=\"https://electrek.co/2020/07/13/tesla-former-vp-quality-explains-issues/\">which apparently can vary depending on which car you get</a>.</p><p>True, the Long Range most likely has a longer range than the 2, and Tesla's Supercharger network is far more extensive, but I wager most of an EV's charging takes place at home over the course of its ownership. The <a href=\"https://www.utilitydive.com/news/chargepoint-commits-1b-to-expand-ev-charging-as-ocasio-cortez-others-unve/571979/\">US charging infrastructure network is expanding</a>, too, so it's not like there won't be anywhere to charge a Polestar.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c02c323fc4001e0d7118?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_4\" height=\"1406\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>I also think Polestar's free pickup and delivery service is pretty sweet. It's unfortunate for those who don't live near a Polestar location, but for those who do, it's very convenient. Should Polestar really catch on here and expand its locations, it also expands the area it can service — no local franchise laws to tangle with.&#160;</p><p>Yes, on paper, it seems like the Model 3 has the 2 beat. The Tesla is slightly cheaper, has a longer range, offers a Performance model, and can be optioned with the very capable Autopilot system. But choosing a car is rarely a logical act, and being in the Polestar just made me happier.</p><p>Sometimes it's not more complicated than that.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64b659323fc4001e0d70e8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Polestar 2_OEM_22\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Polestar 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Polestar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
